item.content:encoded:
Magento read error on connection when using Redis. If you are using Redis as cache in Magento and read timeout is not specified, you may get this error. Below is how it looks in the error report.

{code}read error on connection

Trace:
#1 lib/Mage/Cache/Backend/Redis.php(210): Credis_Client->hGet(‚Äòzc:k:0cd_FPC_DE‚Ä¶‚Äô, ‚Äòd‚Äô)
#2 lib/Zend/Cache/Core.php(303): Mage_Cache_Backend_Redis->load(‚Äò0cd_FPC_DESIGN_‚Ä¶‚Äô, false)
#3 lib/Varien/Cache/Core.php(158): Zend_Cache_Core->load(‚ÄòFPC_DESIGN_EXCE‚Ä¶‚Äô, false, false)
#4 app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/Cache.php(379): Varien_Cache_Core->load(‚ÄòFPC_DESIGN_EXCE‚Ä¶‚Äô)
#5 app/code/core/Enterprise/PageCache/Model/Processor.php(185): Mage_Core_Model_Cache->load(‚ÄòFPC_DESIGN_EXCE‚Ä¶‚Äô)
#6 app/code/core/Enterprise/PageCache/Model/Processor.php(146): Enterprise_PageCache_Model_Processor->_getDesignPackage()
#7 app/code/core/Enterprise/PageCache/Model/Processor.php(108): Enterprise_PageCache_Model_Processor->_createRequestIds()
#8 app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/Cache.php(703): Enterprise_PageCache_Model_Processor->__construct()
#9 app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/Cache.php(685): Mage_Core_Model_Cache->_getProcessor(‚ÄòEnterprise_Page‚Ä¶‚Äô)
#10 app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/App.php(340): Mage_Core_Model_Cache->processRequest()
#11 app/Mage.php(683): Mage_Core_Model_App->run(Array)
#12 /var/www/source/index.php(87): Mage::run(‚Äù, ‚Äòstore‚Äô){/code}

The solution (atleast for us) was to add a read_timeout config option in app/etc/local.xml where you have configured Redis cache for Magento.

{code}
Mage_Cache_Backend_Redis
<backend_options>
127.0.0.1 6379 0 <force_standalone>0</force_standalone>
<connect_retries>1</connect_retries>
<read_timeout>10</read_timeout> 57600 <compress_data>0</compress_data>
</backend_options>
{/code}

HTH!

item.title: Magento enterprise: show top mini cart when product is added to cart
item.description: Magento Enterprise comes with a top header mini-cart, which displays all the items with their custom options added to cart, when you click on My Cart in the header. This is a good feature, but what if you want to show this mini-cart each time a product is added, without clicking on that link? I will show you here how to display your mini cart automatically when a product is added to cart.
item.content:encoded:
Magento Enterprise comes with a top header mini-cart, which displays all the items with their custom options added to cart, when you click on My Cart in the header. This is a good feature, but what if you want to show this mini-cart each time a product is added, without clicking on that link? I will show you here how to display your mini cart automatically when a product is added to cart.

Open your cartheader.php file, which is located at:
app/design/frontend/enterprise/YOUR_DESIGN/template/checkout/cart/cartheader.phtml

In the last few lines of this file, you should find the below line in javascript:

{code type=javascript}Enterprise.TopCart.initialize(‚ÄòtopCartContent‚Äô);
// Below can be used to show minicart after item added
// Enterprise.TopCart.showCart(7);{/code}

Replace the last line, //Enterprise.TopCart.showCart(7); with the below lines:

{code type=javascript}jQuery( document ).ready(function() {
if( jQuery(‚Äò#messages_product_view‚Äô).children().length ){
if(jQuery(‚Äò#messages_product_view‚Äô).children().children().attr(‚Äòclass‚Äô) == ‚Äòsuccess-msg‚Äô) {
if(jQuery(‚Äò.success-msg ul li span‚Äô).text().indexOf(‚Äòwas added to your shopping cart‚Äô) > -1) {
Enterprise.TopCart.showCart(7);
}
}
}
});{/code}

So whenever in the page, there will be an element with ID ‚Äú#messages_product_view‚Äù and it has a children with class ‚Äúsuccess-msg‚Äù and it has a ul/li/span with text containing ‚Äúwas added to your shopping cart‚Äù, we will show the top mini-cart. This is only true when an product is added to shopping cart.

You can also show top mini-cart without this jquery hack, by making a new module in Magento and catch the event when product is added to cart. Then programmatically clicking the top mini cart to display it. But according to me this small piece of code is better than to create whole new Magento module.

HTH!

item.title: Magento remove session id from URL
item.description:
Magento displays session ID in url, something like:
{code}http://loca.lho.st?__SID=2wewesfdgfsdm{/code}

You can remove this in two ways:

1. Go to your Magento admin panel > System > Configuration > Web.
Under Session Validation Settings, set ‚ÄúNo‚Äù against label ‚ÄúUse SID on the Frontend‚Äù.
If this doesn‚Äôt work, then move to option two below.

2. Edit the file at app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/App.php (somewhere around line 222),
{code type=php}protected $_useSessionInUrl = true;{/code}
Change that value to ‚Äúfalse‚Äù. That should now prevent session IDs appearing in URL.

item.title: Magento Error: Fatal error: Call to a member function rewrite() on a non-object in app/code/core/Mage/Core/Controller/Varien/Front.php on line 165
item.description:
Magento Error: Fatal error: Call to a member function rewrite() on a non-object in /var/www/magento/app/code/core/Mage/Core/Controller/Varien/Front.php on line 165

While upgrading Magento from 1.7 to 1.8 version, this error generally appears and stops the site from loading.

We can get rid of this error simply by clearing the cache:
{code}rm -rf var/cache/*{/code}
If you don‚Äôt have terminal access, clear all the contents of var/cache/ directory.

Further if you have memcached or other caching system installed, flush them as well.

item.title: Magento debug XML (layout, config) files
item.description: In Magento if there is any error in XML file, Magento silently ignores it and continues further parsing. So you never get to know where is the actual error and makes it difficult to debug. You can‚Äôt even do any logging in XML file and also Magento don‚Äôt tell that error is in XML. It makes debugging almost impossible and ends up wasting in hours to find some silly mistake.
item.content:encoded:
In Magento if there is any error in XML file, Magento silently ignores it and continues further parsing. So you never get to know where is the actual error and makes it difficult to debug. You can‚Äôt even do any logging in XML file and also Magento don‚Äôt tell that error is in XML. It makes debugging almost impossible and ends up wasting in hours to find some silly mistake.

But we can know if there is any error in XML (layout.xml or config.xml or any xml file) if you use below code in the controller action which is being called. The browser will display WHOLE XML code and if it encounters any error in it, simply gives where is the error in the XML tree.

If you are trying to load let‚Äôs say Product View page, then put this code in Mage/Catalog/controllers/ProductController.php file‚Äôs viewAction() method temporarily to display whole XML tree to find out error(s) if any. As we are saying to display the page as XML, the page will break if it finds any mal-formed XML code and will show where is the mistake.

{code type=php}header(‚ÄúContent-Type: text/xml‚Äù);
echo Mage::app()->getConfig()->getNode()->asXml();exit;{/code}

If you want to debug Layout Handles only, you can just check by this code:
{code type=php}header(‚ÄúContent-Type: text/xml‚Äù);
echo Mage::app()->getLayout()->getUpdate()->getHandles();exit;{/code}

item.title: Magento delete empty categories and sub-categories
item.description:
Remove all empty categories and sub-categories in Magento. When there are empty categories, the website shows empty page in those categories in frontend. Create a file in the magento root, I will name it rmvEmptyCats.php, with following code:

{code type=php}require ‚Äúapp/Mage.php‚Äù;
umask(0);
Mage::app();

$categoryCollection = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/category‚Äô)->getCollection()
->addFieldToFilter(‚Äòlevel‚Äô, array(‚Äògteq‚Äô => 2)); //greater than root category id

foreach($categoryCollection as $category) {
if ($category->getProductCount() === 0) {
$category->delete();
}
}

echo ‚ÄòEmpty Categories Deleted!‚Äô;{/code}

item.title: Magento convert attribute type from TEXT to DROPDOWN
item.description:
Magento convert attribute type from TEXT (varchar) to DROPDOWN / SELECT (int) in Backend.
Magento doesn‚Äôt have this in-built so we will have to do it in our own way. We will convert our existing attribute which is in TEXT type, to DROPDOWN (select). Let‚Äôs say our attribute code is ‚Äúvendor‚Äù, you will need to replace it with your own attribute code in all the code below.

WARNING: All the coupon codes that uses this attribute for discounts/promotions will GO AWAY! Please note down all the coupon code Conditions and Actions (which uses this attribute) before converting the attribute.
item.content:encoded:
Magento convert attribute type from TEXT (varchar) to DROPDOWN / SELECT (int) in Backend.
Magento doesn‚Äôt have this in-built so we will have to do it in our own way. We will convert our existing attribute which is in TEXT type, to DROPDOWN (select). Let‚Äôs say our attribute code is ‚Äúvendor‚Äù, you will need to replace it with your own attribute code in all the code below.

WARNING: All the coupon codes that uses this attribute for discounts/promotions will GO AWAY! Please note down all the coupon code Conditions and Actions (which uses this attribute) before converting the attribute.

Step 1.) Backup your database.
{code type=sql}mysqldump -u mysqluser -p mysqldbname > mysqldbname_backup.sql{/code}

Step 2.) Export all the values of the attribute you want to convert in a CSV file. For that, create a file vendor.php (your_attribute.php) in your magento root with following code inside it:
{code type=php}require ‚Äúapp/Mage.php‚Äù;
umask(0);
Mage::app();

$collection = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)
->getCollection()
->addAttributeToSelect(‚Äòsku‚Äô)
->addAttributeToSelect(‚Äòvendor‚Äô); //replace vendor with your attribute code

$data = $collection->getData();

foreach ($data as $product) {
echo $product[‚Äòentity_id‚Äô] . ‚Äú,‚Äù . $product[‚Äòvendor‚Äô].‚Äù\n‚Äù;
}{/code}

After saving the above code, run it from command line:

{code}php vendor.php > vendor.csv{/code}
You should now have all the attribute‚Äôs data with product ID in the vendor.csv (your_attribute.csv) file.

Step 3.) Now get all the unique values you have in the attribute‚Äôs data, which we will be filling them as options of select dropdown.
Run following mysql command to get all the unique values and copy them in a new file:
{code type=sql}select distinct value from catalog_product_entity_varchar where attribute_id in (select attribute_id from eav_attribute where attribute_code=‚Äôvendor‚Äô); //replace vendor with your own attribute code{/code}

After this step, we have all the attribute‚Äôs data in CSV file, and all the UNIQUE attribute values.

Step 4.) Note all the settings of the attribute and Delete the attribute from backend Manage Attributes screen. Now create new attribute from there with SAME attribute code but different Frontend Type (Dropdown). Rest all the settings will be same as you had it before. Save it. Go to Manage Attribute Sets page and assign the attribute to the Group it was assigned to before.

Step 5.) Now we have to insert all the options to this attribute so that the values are shown in the dropdown. Edit your vendor.php file and replace the code with below:
{code type=php}require ‚Äúapp/Mage.php‚Äù;
umask(0);
Mage::app();

$installer = new Mage_Eav_Model_Entity_Setup(‚Äòcore_setup‚Äô);
$installer->startSetup();

//Change this‚Ä¶.
$values = array(‚Äúval1‚Ä≥,‚Äùval2‚Äù); //your unique attributes values that you copied in a new file
$attrCode = ‚Äòvendor‚Äô; //your attribute code here
//‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

$values = array_map(‚Äòutf8_encode‚Äô,$values); //If you‚Äôre using special characters
$iProductEntityTypeId = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)->getResource()->getTypeId();
$aOption = array();
$aOption[‚Äòattribute_id‚Äô] = $installer->getAttributeId($iProductEntityTypeId, $attrCode);
for($iCount=0;$iCountaddAttributeOption($aOption);

$installer->endSetup();{/code}

After running this, check your attribute manage page and see if all the values are updated or not. You can find the values in ‚ÄúManage Labels/Options‚Äù tab of attribute‚Äôs Manage Attributes screen.

Step 6.) Now comes the main part which will insert the attribute values in the database. The old values are stored in catalog_product_entity_varchar (text type), while now the values should go to catalog_product_entity_int (dropdown type). Replace your vendor.php file with below code:

{code type=php}require ‚Äúapp/Mage.php‚Äù;
umask(0);
Mage::app();

$attribute = Mage::getModel(‚Äòeav/config‚Äô)->getAttribute(‚Äòcatalog_product‚Äô, ‚Äòvendor‚Äô); //change to your attribute code

foreach ($allOptions as $instance) {
$myArray[$instance[‚Äòlabel‚Äô]] = $instance[‚Äòvalue‚Äô];
}

if (($handle = fopen(‚Äúvendor.csv‚Äù, ‚Äúr‚Äù)) !== FALSE) { //change to your attribute .csv file
while (($data = fgetcsv($handle, 1000, ‚Äú,‚Äù)) !== FALSE) {
list($_id, $_value) = $data;

$product = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)->load($_id);
$product->setVendor($myArray[$_value]); //setVendor should be setYourAttributeCode

try {
$product->getResource()->saveAttribute($product, ‚Äòvendor‚Äô); //change to your attribute code
} catch(Exception $e) {

}
}

First of all, removing live orders is not recommended. But if you are sure you want to remove orders (test orders?) then you can do so by custom script below. item.title: Magento redirect from observer
item.description:
Redirection in observer doesn‚Äôt work normally as it do in Blocks, templates and controllers. Also there is no standard code to redirect from observer that works in every situation.

You will need an argument to achieve redirect when using below code:
{code type=php}public function observingMethod(Varien_Event_Observer $observer)
{
$observer->getRequest()->setParam(‚Äòreturn_url‚Äô,$urlToRedirect);
}{/code}
Note that $observer object should have getRequest() method to make above code work. You may need to use $observer->getEvent()->getFront()->getRequest() otherwise, or simply var_dump/Mage::log $observer to get better idea what methods the object have.

Redirection in observer doesn‚Äôt work normally as it do in Blocks, templates and controllers. Also there is no standard code to redirect from observer that works in every situation.

You will need an argument to achieve redirect when using below code:
{code type=php}public function observingMethod(Varien_Event_Observer $observer)
{
$observer->getRequest()->setParam(‚Äòreturn_url‚Äô,$urlToRedirect);
}{/code}
Note that $observer object should have getRequest() method to make above code work. You may need to use $observer->getEvent()->getFront()->getRequest() otherwise, or simply var_dump/Mage::log $observer to get better idea what methods the object have.

Or you can use below code which is not recommended:
{code type=php}public function observingMethod() {
header(‚ÄòLocation: ‚Äò . $urlToRedirect);
exit;
}{/code}
We don‚Äôt need any arguments using above method.

Another approach, again not recommended:
{code type=php}public function observingMethod(Varien_Event_Observer $observer)
{
$response = $observer->getResponse();
//$response = Mage::app()->getFrontController()->getResponse();
$response->setRedirect($urlToRedirect);

Mage::app()->getFrontController()->sendResponse();
}{/code}

item.title: Magento products not showing in categories
item.description:
If your Magento products are not showing up in frontend category pages, that can be because one or more of the below points are not done correctly.

The products must have following set correctly to appear in the category pages in frontend. You can check all the below things in Manage Products screen of any individual product.
‚Äì Status must be Enabled (under General tab)
‚Äì Visiblility should be Catalog OR Catalog, Search (under General tab)
‚Äì Stock Qty (quantity) should be greater than Qty for Item‚Äôs Status to Become Out of Stock (under Inventory tab)
‚Äì Stock Availability must be IN STOCK
‚Äì Category should be assigned (under Categories tab)
‚Äì Website must be assigned (under Websites tab)
item.content:encoded:
If your Magento products are not showing up in frontend category pages, that can be because one or more of the below points are not done correctly.

The products must have following set correctly to appear in the category pages in frontend. You can check all the below things in Manage Products screen of any individual product.
‚Äì Status must be Enabled (under General tab)
‚Äì Visiblility should be Catalog OR Catalog, Search (under General tab)
‚Äì Stock Qty (quantity) should be greater than Qty for Item‚Äôs Status to Become Out of Stock (under Inventory tab)
‚Äì Stock Availability must be IN STOCK
‚Äì Category should be assigned (under Categories tab)
‚Äì Website must be assigned (under Websites tab)

Clear the cache, re-index the indexes related to product (Product prices, Product flat data and Category products) and everything should work as expected.

item.title: Magento tweak .htaccess for performance optimization
item.description:
Tweak .htaccess for performance optimization in Magento. It will not sky rocket your website, but will show notable improvement. The default Magento .htaccess comes with performance optimization, but commented by default. I will show you here which lines to uncomment and improve the performance.

Compressing web pages with mod_deflate

The mod_deflate module allows the Apache2 web service to compress files and deliver them to browser that can handle them. With mod_deflate you can compress HTML, text or XML files by upto 70% of their original sizes! Thus, saving you server traffic and speeding up page loads.
item.content:encoded:
Tweak .htaccess for performance optimization in Magento. It will not sky rocket your website, but will show notable improvement. The default Magento .htaccess comes with performance optimization, but commented by default. I will show you here which lines to uncomment and improve the performance.

Compressing web pages with mod_deflate

The mod_deflate module allows the Apache2 web service to compress files and deliver them to browser that can handle them. With mod_deflate you can compress HTML, text or XML files by upto 70% of their original sizes! Thus, saving you server traffic and speeding up page loads.

Check your .htaccess file for below code, I have removed hashes before few lines to uncomment them for performance.
{code}

############################################
## enable apache served files compression
## http://developer.yahoo.com/performance/rules.html#gzip

Insert filter on all content

SetOutputFilter DEFLATE

Insert filter on selected content types only

AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain text/xml text/css text/javascript

Netscape 4.x has some problems‚Ä¶

BrowserMatch ^Mozilla/4 gzip-only-text/html

Netscape 4.06-4.08 have some more problems

BrowserMatch ^Mozilla/4\.0[678] no-gzip

MSIE masquerades as Netscape, but it is fine

BrowserMatch \bMSIE !no-gzip !gzip-only-text/html

Don‚Äôt compress images

SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png)$ no-gzip dont-vary

Make sure proxies don‚Äôt deliver the wrong content

Header append Vary User-Agent env=!dont-vary

{/code}

Enabling expires header with mod_expires

Make browser cache static files with Apache2‚Äôs mod_expires module.

{code}

############################################
## Add default Expires header
## http://developer.yahoo.com/performance/rules.html#expires

ExpiresActive On
ExpiresDefault ‚Äúaccess plus 1 year‚Äù

{/code}

item.title: Magento get products without category
item.description: Get a list of all orphaned products which are not associated with any category in Magento. Sometimes you may have missed to select categories for products by mistake when filling new product details, and now want to list them and assign categories to those products. You can‚Äôt get it from the Magento admin screen so you will need to run below MySQL query to get all the products without categories.
item.content:encoded:
Get a list of all orphaned products which are not associated with any category in Magento. Sometimes you may have missed to select categories for products by mistake when filling new product details, and now want to list them and assign categories to those products. You can‚Äôt get it from the Magento admin screen so you will need to run below MySQL query to get all the products without categories.

{code type=sql}SELECT e.entity_id, e.sku, e.name FROM catalog_product_entity AS e LEFT JOIN catalog_category_product AS cp ON cp.product_id = e.entity_id WHERE cp.category_id IS NULL{/code}

Above sql query will simply bring the product ID, SKU, Name of products where category is NULL. You can add more columns in select (like e.*) to list full details of products.

item.title: Magento partial refund creditmemo programatically
item.description:
Suppose you have a product which is out of stock or something and you want to refund that product line item from order programatically. The below code will create creditmemo/refund for the products with certain SKU if it finds it in the line items of the order.

{code type=php}Mage::app(‚Äòadmin‚Äô); //You can create creditmemo in admin area only
//You should have $orderID as order increment ID and $sku as product SKU you want to refund for.
$order = Mage::getModel(‚Äòsales/order‚Äô)->loadByIncrementId($orderID);
$orderItem = $order->getItemsCollection()->getItemByColumnValue(‚Äòsku‚Äô, $sku);
$service = Mage::getModel(‚Äòsales/service_order‚Äô, $order);
$data = array(
‚Äòqtys‚Äô => array(
$orderItem->getId() => 1 //qty to refund.. $orderItem->getQty()
)
);
$creditMemo = $service->prepareCreditmemo($data)->save();{/code}

item.title: Magento system config 404 error
item.description:
Magento gives 404 error / Forbidden error / Access denied error when you try to open the screen of your newly written config/system XML code because either of 2 reasons.

1.) You have written the code CORRECTLY, but Magento needs to write permissions for that module in session to show it.
‚Äì Just logout and login again and you should see your newly developed screen.

2.) You have some error in your ACL role code. Magento needs the ACL role information to allow admin view the admin module.
‚Äì Check your ACL code definition again and make sure everything there is correct.

item.title: WordPress plugin install without FTP
item.description: WordPress generally gives you page to fill FTP connection details when you try to install new plugin or update wordpress. The reason is it cannot write to wp-content directory due of lack of permissions to write. The best way is to change permissions and ownership of wp-content directory. But if you can‚Äôt do that because of some reason, then add the below line of code in your wp-config.php
item.content:encoded:
WordPress generally gives you page to fill FTP connection details when you try to install new plugin or update wordpress. The reason is it cannot write to wp-content directory due of lack of permissions to write. The best way is to change permissions and ownership of wp-content directory. But if you can‚Äôt do that because of some reason, then add the below line of code in your wp-config.php

{code type=php}define(‚ÄòFS_METHOD‚Äô, ‚Äòdirect‚Äô);{/code}

Other way is to change permissions and ownerships to wp-content directory as said.
{code}chown -R www-data wordpress
chgrp -R www-data wordpress
chmod -R 755 wordpress/wp-content{/code}

item.title: MYSQL LIKE match whole word only
item.description:
Mysql LIKE clause match exact whole word only while searching. Search the words with space in mysql database.

If you want to search for exact word using LIKE clause, you can‚Äôt do it just using percentage (%) sign around the keyword as it will search for partial words too. For example, the below query will match all the words which contain ‚Äúsome‚Äù:

{code type=sql}SELECT * FROM tablename WHERE columnname LIKE ‚Äò%some%‚Äô;{/code}
item.content:encoded:
Mysql LIKE clause match exact whole word only while searching. Search the words with space in mysql database.

If you want to search for exact word using LIKE clause, you can‚Äôt do it just using percentage (%) sign around the keyword as it will search for partial words too. For example, the below query will match all the words which contain ‚Äúsome‚Äù:

{code type=sql}SELECT * FROM tablename WHERE columnname LIKE ‚Äò%some%‚Äô;{/code}

It will find all the instances where it finds some, as a whole or a part. some, someone, something, handsome, isometric are all MATCHED using above query. Ofcourse there will be many results which are UNRELATED.

But what if you only want some, as an exact word WITH space and WITHOUT any extra heading and trailing characters?

This query will do exactly that:

{code type=sql}SELECT * FROM tablename WHERE columnname = ‚Äòsome‚Äô OR columnname LIKE ‚Äò% some‚Äô OR columnname LIKE ‚Äòsome %‚Äô OR columnname LIKE ‚Äò% some %‚Äô;{/code}

In above query we are making sure that all the some instances are retrieved, whether they are present in the START or in the END or in the MIDDLE of the columnname field.

item.title: OroCRM Installation guide
item.description: I will show you here how to install OroCRM in your machine. OroCRM is the latest open-source CRM tool developed by MageCore. It‚Äôs little difficult to make it work on your system as there are some issues which occurs in installing it, and there is also no thorough documentation as of now. It‚Äôs in pre-alpha release and just publicly available since 3 weeks. I will show you how to install OroCRM assuming you have Linux system.
item.content:encoded:
I will show you here how to install OroCRM in your machine. OroCRM is the latest open-source CRM tool developed by MageCore. It‚Äôs little difficult to make it work on your system as there are some issues which occurs in installing it, and there is also no thorough documentation as of now. It‚Äôs in pre-alpha release and just publicly available since 3 weeks. I will show you how to install OroCRM assuming you have Linux system.

Requirements: Symfony 2, Doctrine 2, PHP >= 5.3.3

‚Äì Clone the CRM application Git repository in your local. It should be done in your web server‚Äôs root directory (e.g. /var/www/).
{code}git clone http://gitlab.orocrm.com/crm-application.git{/code}

‚Äì Now switch to the newly created crm-application directory and make the parameters.yml file with your configuration changes.
{code}cd crm-application
cp app/config/parameters.dist.yml app/config/parameters.yml
vi app/config/parameters.yml{/code}

‚Äì Edit composer.json, add symfony/assestic-bundle to prevent future error:

PHP Fatal error: Class ‚ÄòAssetic\Util\PathUtils‚Äô not found in /var/www/crm-application/vendor/symfony/assetic-bundle/Symfony/Bundle/AsseticBundle/Command/DumpCommand.php on line 216

{code}replace:
‚Äúrequire‚Äù: {
‚Äúphp‚Äù: ‚Äú>=5.3.3‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/platform‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/crm‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù
},{/code}
with
{code}‚Äùrequire‚Äù: {
‚Äúphp‚Äù: ‚Äú>=5.3.3‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/platform‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/crm‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù,
‚Äúsymfony/assetic-bundle‚Äù: ‚Äú2.3.*@dev‚Äù
},{/code}

‚Äì This will install composer. If you already have it, just ignore this step.
{code}curl -s https://getcomposer.org/installer | php{/code}

‚Äì This will install all the things which are listed in composer.json file and necessary by Oro; like zendframework, doctrine, twig, symfony, monolog, oro, etc..
{code}php composer.phar install ‚Äìprefer-dist{/code}

Change permissions of cache and logs directory to world-writeable. Otherwise you will get errors like:

PHP Fatal error: Uncaught exception ‚ÄòRuntimeException‚Äô with message ‚ÄòUnable to write in the logs directory (/var/www/crm-application/app/logs)\n‚Äô in ‚Ä¶
PHP Fatal error: Uncaught exception ‚ÄòRuntimeException‚Äô with message ‚ÄòUnable to create the cache directory (/var/www/crm-application/app/cache/prod)\n‚Äô in ‚Ä¶

{code}chmod -R 777 app/cache
chmod -R 777 app/logs
or, find app/cache app/logs -type d -exec chmod 777 {} +{/code}

‚Äì Finally, run the install bash script
{code}./install.sh{/code}

You should now able to see the login screen of OroCRM if everything went good. If you face any error, check below errors and how to solve it.

Login credentials are:
username: admin
password: admin

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-

Fatal error: Class ‚ÄòAssetic\Util\PathUtils‚Äô not found in /var/www/crm-application/vendor/symfony/assetic-bundle/Symfony/Bundle/AsseticBundle/Command/DumpCommand.php on line 216

edit composer.json, replace:
{code}‚Äùrequire‚Äù: {
‚Äúphp‚Äù: ‚Äú>=5.3.3‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/platform‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/crm‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù
},{/code}
with
{code}‚Äùrequire‚Äù: {
‚Äúphp‚Äù: ‚Äú>=5.3.3‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/platform‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù,
‚Äúoro/crm‚Äù: ‚Äúdev-master‚Äù,
‚Äúsymfony/assetic-bundle‚Äù: ‚Äú2.3.*@dev‚Äù
},{/code}

and run

{code}php composer.phar upate ‚Äìprefer-dist
./install.sh{/code}

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-

Are you missing JS and CSS files? Skinless? Run below two commands.
{code}php composer.phar upate ‚Äìprefer-dist
php app/console assetic:dump{/code}

It will output:
Dumping all dev assets.

item.title: Magento get attribute value
item.description: To get product attribute value in Magento is very common. You will need it everytime when dealing with catalog products in your development. Attributes have different types, which can be any of Text Field, Text Area, Date, Yes/No, Multiple Select, Dropdown, Price, Gallery, Media Image, Fixed Product Tax (as you can see in backend Manage Attributes > New Attribute > Catalog Input Type for Store Owner). To get the value for these different types of attributes there is no one straight line of code, you will need to use different code for getting values from plain attributes, while different code to get values from select and multiselect attributes.
item.content:encoded:
To get product attribute value in Magento is very common. You will need it everytime when dealing with catalog products in your development. Attributes have different types, which can be any of Text Field, Text Area, Date, Yes/No, Multiple Select, Dropdown, Price, Gallery, Media Image, Fixed Product Tax (as you can see in backend Manage Attributes > New Attribute > Catalog Input Type for Store Owner). To get the value for these different types of attributes there is no one straight line of code, you will need to use different code for getting values from plain attributes, while different code to get values from select and multiselect attributes.

Get attribute value for PLAIN TEXT, TEXTAREA or DATE type attribute:
{code type=php}$attribute_value = $product->getShirtSize(); //for shirt_size attribute{/code}

Get value from SELECT, MULTISELECT, DROPDOWN or YES/NO attributes:
{code type=php}$attribute_value = $product->getAttributeText($attribute_code);{/code}
OR
{code type=php}$attribute_value = $product->getResource()->getAttribute($attribute_code)->getFrontend()->getValue($product);{/code}

Get value from PRICE attributes:
{code type=php}$attribute_value = $product->getNew_price(); //for attribute code ‚Äúnew_price‚Äù{/code}
and in product list page,
{code type=php}$attribute_value = $product->getNewPrice();{/code}

Get attribute value by attribute code and productID WITHOUT loading whole product
{code type=php}$attribute_value = Mage::getResourceModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)->getAttributeRawValue($product_id, $attribute_code, $store_id);{/code}

item.title: PHP redirect without header()
item.description:
It‚Äôs very frustrating when you want to redirect from one page to another, and you get the error:

Warning: Cannot modify header information ‚Äì headers already sent by (output started at /some/filename.php:12) in /some/filename.php on line 99

The problem is Headers are already sent, or in simple language the output is already sent to browser when your header() function is called. The best solution is not to pass headers (send html/output to browser) till the point header() function is fired.
item.content:encoded:
It‚Äôs very frustrating when you want to redirect from one page to another, and you get the error:

Warning: Cannot modify header information ‚Äì headers already sent by (output started at /some/filename.php:12) in /some/filename.php on line 99

The problem is Headers are already sent, or in simple language the output is already sent to browser when your header() function is called. The best solution is not to pass headers (send html/output to browser) till the point header() function is fired.

Another way is to use output buffering. Without output buffering (the default), your HTML is sent to the browser in pieces as PHP processes through your script. With output buffering, your HTML is stored in a variable and sent to the browser as one piece at the end of your script. For using this method, you have to start your file with ob_start(); so that output gets buffered.

But what if you don‚Äôt care whether the output is sent or not, you anyway want the redirect to work? This simple function will do the trick for you. It will check if headers are not sent, then it will call the PHP‚Äôs header function to redirect. But if the headers are sent, it will use Javascript to redirect to the URL you want.

{code type=php}function redirect($url)
{
if (!headers_sent())
{
header(‚ÄòLocation: ‚Äò.$url);
exit;
}
else
{
echo ‚Äò’; echo ‘window.location.href="’.$url.’";’; echo ‘‚Äò;
echo ‚Äò‚Äò;
echo ‚Äò‚Äò;
echo ‚Äò‚Äò;
exit;
}
}{/code}

item.title: OroCRM

Dima Soroka, who was Lead Architect for Magento is the VP of Engineering in Oro Inc. With such industry leaders, OroCRM is believed to be the next big CRM for many e-commerce frameworks. item.content:encoded:
OroCRM is an open-source Client Relationship Management tool founded in 2012 by Yoav Kutner, previous CTO and co-founder of Magento AND Jary Carter, former VP of Sales and Channel of Magento. Dima Soroka, who was Lead Architect for Magento is the VP of Engineering in Oro Inc. With such industry leaders, OroCRM is believed to be the next big CRM for many e-commerce frameworks. Personally I like this CRM because there are no good CRM available in PHP which can seamlessly integrate with Magento and offer flexibility that clients need. OroCRM is aimed to deal with these issues where it will offer flexible needs, reporting and marketing tools for multi-channel commerce.

Currently it‚Äôs in development stage, but they made the code available so that users can check out and use the application already. They highly recommend to not use it yet on production. OroCRM is created on it‚Äôs own Oro Platform, Business Application Platform (BAP). This Platform includes features like Navigation Menus, Form auto-save, Data Audit, Data Grid, Users, Groups and ACL, REST and SOAP APIs and Advanced Search. These are the foundation of Oro Platform which reduces development time in business application development.

It is licensed under open source license (OSL 3.0), giving the users permission to download and modify the code as per their wish. You can download Oro Platform and CRM from Github:

Platform: https://github.com/orocrm/platform.git
Platform Application: https://github.com/orocrm/platform-application.git

item.content:encoded:
Prototype JS comes with many utility methods which are very powerful and useful while development. Below methods are shorthands or aliases of other Prototype methods, created to save time in typing.

These are created as they are very commonly used, to make developer‚Äôs life easier.

$() Function

‚Äì Retuns the element that has the ID passed as an argument
Shorthand to: document.getElementById()
Example:
{code type=javascript}
$(‚Äúcar‚Äù); //returns element having id ‚Äúcar‚Äù
$(‚Äúcar‚Äù).hide(); //hides div where id is ‚Äúcar‚Äù
$(‚Äúcar‚Äù).addClassName(‚Äúhidden‚Äù); //adds class name ‚Äúhidden‚Äù to element with id ‚Äúcar‚Äù
{/code}

$$() Function

‚Äì Returns the elements that has CSS selectors as an argument
Shorthand to: document.getElementById() + document.getElementsByTagName() + prototype‚Äôs getElementsByClassName()
Example:
{code type=javascript}
$$(‚Äò.active‚Äô);//returns all the elements having class ‚Äúactive‚Äù
$$(‚Äòdiv.active p, #car a‚Äô).invoke(‚Äòhide‚Äô); //hides all the ‚Äúp‚Äù tags under div having class ‚Äúactive‚Äù, hides all links under element having id ‚Äúcar‚Äù
$$(‚Äòdiv:empty‚Äô); //all divs without any content, version 1.5.1 and above
{/code}

$F() Function

‚Äì Returns the value of a form control, like text boxes or dropdown options
Shorthand to: Form.Element.getValue, Form.Element#getValue
{code type=html}

$R() Function

‚Äì Builds a range object, shorthand to ‚Äúnew ObjectRange()‚Äù
Shorthand to: ObjectRange()
Example:
{code type=javascript}
var range = $R(10, 20, false);
range.each(function(value, index){
alert(value);
});
{/code}

$H() Function

‚Äì Converts objects into enumerable Hash objects which resembles associate arrays.
Shorthand to: Hash
{code type=javascript}
var a = {
firstname: ‚ÄòJohn‚Äô,
lastname: ‚ÄòDoe‚Äô
};

var h = $H(a);
alert( h.get(‚Äòfirstname‚Äô) ); //alert‚Äôs John
{/code}

$A() Function

‚Äì Converts the single argument passed into an Array object.
Shorthand to: Array.from
{code type=javascript}
var paras = $A(document.getElementsByTagName(‚Äòp‚Äô)); //gets all the paragraph‚Äôs in array format
paras.each(Element.hide); //looping paragraphs and hiding them each
$(paras.last()).show(); //showing the last paragraph
{/code}

$w() Function

‚Äì Splits a string into an array with whitespace as a delimiter.
Shorthand to: Ruby‚Äôs %w{foo bar} or Perl‚Äôs qw(foo bar).
{code type=javascript}
var str = ‚Äòapples bananas kiwis‚Äô;
$w(str).each(function(fruit){
alert(fruit); //alerts 3 times with values apples, bananas and kiwis
})
{/code}

item.title: return false vs preventDefault in javascript
item.description:
This post will help you to differentiate between javascript‚Äôs return false, preventDefault, stopPropagation and stopImmediatePropagation.

The first thing you learn when using javascript is to use return false. That‚Äôs the best thing we think to cancel browser‚Äôs default behavior, to stop further execution of an event. If you are using a simple function which returns what you want, then probably you won‚Äôt notice anything wrong in using return false. But when you want event to propagate, return false will not be helpful and will give unexpected result.
item.content:encoded:
This post will help you to differentiate between javascript‚Äôs return false, preventDefault, stopPropagation and stopImmediatePropagation.

The first thing you learn when using javascript is to use return false. That‚Äôs the best thing we think to cancel browser‚Äôs default behavior, to stop further execution of an event. If you are using a simple function which returns what you want, then probably you won‚Äôt notice anything wrong in using return false. But when you want event to propagate, return false will not be helpful and will give unexpected result.

What is event propagation?

When a single event, such as a mouse click, if is handled by two or more event handlers defined in various location of the DOM hiearachy, then the event handling starts by executing for individual elements at the lowest level. There are two models of this event propagation, event bubbling and event capturing.

Event bubbling is when an event has more than one event handler and event handling execution starts from bottom to top i.e. from individual links to it‚Äôs parent element (e.g. form or body or document) having it‚Äôs own event handler.

{code type=html}

On clicking on the link in the above example code, first the hyperlink‚Äôs event will be handled, then form‚Äôs event will get handled, and at last body‚Äôs event will get handled. This is event bubbling, which bubble up from bottom to top.

Event capturing is opposite to event bubbling, where event handling execution starts from top to bottom.

If you have such type of architecture, where there are many event handlers for an event, you should not use return false or atleast use it with caution. It can get you in big trouble, as it does preventDefault() and stopPropagation() both and hence never allows further execution of an event.

preventDefault()

It simply stops the default action of an element. Example, prevents the hyperlink from following the URL, prevents the submit button to submit the form. When you have many event handlers and you just want to prevent default event from occuring, just use e.preventDefault() in the top of the function definition. The reason we put preventDefault() in the first line of function is because, if something goes wrong in the code following the preventDefault(), then also it will not allow link or form to get submitted or do whatever action you want it to do. And hence the link or submit button will get submitted. It will still allow further propagation of the event.

Following example prevents the link from following the URL given in href attribute.
{code type=html}

{/code}

stopPropagation()

{code type=html}

stopImmediatePropagation()

If you have multiple event handlers for the event, and you want to stop all other event handlers and current event also from further executing, you should use stopImmediatePropagation().
{code type=html}

$(“div a”).click(function (e) { alert(‘Hi! You can see me’); e.stopImmediatePropagation(); });

$(“div a”).click(function () { alert(‘I will never popup :(’); });

{/code}

So next time when you use return false, think twice do you really want return false or e.preventDefault() or other methods explained above will well-suited there.

item.title: jQuery Prototype conflict, resolve it using noconflict
item.description:
It‚Äôs difficult to use different javascript libraries in the same page. Because they tend to create conflicts with each other‚Äôs code, and often break javascript. One such case is using jQuery and PrototypeJS libraries in the same webpage. Both prototypejs and jquery use $ as their function or variable name which causes issues, as both the libraries will get triggered with that alias.

jQuery provides a method which solves this issue, so that you can use any javascript library with jQuery on the same page. This function is called noConflict(), and it simply uses different symbol/charater(s) you provide rather than dollar ($).

item.content:encoded:
Using jQuery, check whether checkbox is checked or not using 4 different ways in this post.

Below code relies on jQuery‚Äôs is method to check if the checkbox is checked or not. If you want to lookup the checkbox by class instead of id, just replace #yourCheckboxID with .yourCheckboxClassName

{code type=javascript}if($(‚Äò#yourCheckboxID‚Äô).is(‚Äò:checked‚Äô)) {
//do whatever you want here, checkbox is checked
} else {
//do whatever you want here, checkbox is NOT checked
}{/code}

Other alternative to check same thing:
{code type=javascript}$(‚Äò#yourCheckboxID‚Äô).change(function() {
if(this.checked) {
//checkbox is checked
} else {
//checkbox is NOT checked
}
});{/code}
Above code is the better way and my favorite. It will simply observe the checkbox and when it‚Äôs ‚Äúchanged‚Äù, the above function will get triggered. Once triggered, it will check the changed object‚Äôs (checkbox) attribute ‚Äúchecked‚Äù. If it finds the attribute is set, then returns true otherwise returns false.

Third way of doing it is:
{code type=javascript}if($(‚Äò#yourCheckboxID‚Äô).attr(‚Äòchecked‚Äô) {
//checkbox is checked
} else {
//checkbox is NOT checked
}{/code}
Above code will check the checkbox‚Äôs attribute ‚Äúchecked‚Äù, if present it will give true and if not present, it will give false.

Since jQuery 1.6, the new method has been introduced which is called prop. If you are using jQuery 1.6 or above, you can use following code to check if checkbox is checked or not:
{code type=javascript}if($(‚Äò#yourCheckboxID‚Äô).prop(‚Äòchecked‚Äô)) {
//checkbox is checked
} else {
//checkbox is NOT checked
}{/code}

item.title: Magento filter products by status
item.description:
Get all the products with status equal to enabled/disabled.

If you are using Flat Catalog in Magento, you will not get disabled products by this filter as in flat table all the products are only enabled one. You can check if your Magento website uses flat catalog or not by going here:
Admin > System > Configuration > Catalog section > Catalog > Frontend

Check Use Flat Catalog Category and Use Flat Catalog Product, if they are Yes it means you are using flat catalog, if they are No it means you are NOT using flat catalog.

item.title: Magento disable guest checkout / enable guest checkout
item.description:
By default the guest checkout in Magento is enabled and visitors can place an order without registering to the website. Some websites require mandatory login for placing orders, and this default feature should be turned off to disallow guest checkout.

To disable guest checkout, navigate to:

System > Configuration > Sales section > Checkout > Checkout Options
Set Allow Guest Checkout to No

This will now disable any guest checkout in your site.
To enable guest checkout, simply set the above dropdown option to Yes.

item.title: Magento get subcategories of a category by category ID
item.description:

If you have a category ID (current category OR any category) then you can easily get all the subcategories of that particular category.

{code type=php}$catID = $current_category->getId(); //or any specific category id, e.g. 5
$children = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/category‚Äô)->getCategories($catID);
foreach ($children as $category) {
echo $category->getId();
echo $category->getName();
echo $category->getRequestPath();
print_r($category->getData());
}{/code}

item.title: Magento performace optimization, Catalog URL Rewrite Management
item.description: If your Magento site is slow, then one of the reason can be because of Catalog URL Rewrites. You can check in the Magento Admin > Catalog > URL Rewrite Management. If you see the catalog rewrites are very large than expected as per total Categories and Products you have, this will create your site to be slow. This generally gets too large if you edit the categories/products and change it‚Äôs URL. Generally we keep on changing the product URL to optimize for search engines or to correct some typo in the link. Magento saves all the previous category and product URLs even if it is changed many times, resulting in more number of URL rewrites in database. I have seen in one of the project, where total SKUs were near to 4,00,000 while the URL Rewrites were near to 46,00,000 with just one website and store!
item.content:encoded:
If your Magento site is slow, then one of the reason can be because of Catalog URL Rewrites. You can check in the Magento Admin > Catalog > URL Rewrite Management. If you see the catalog rewrites are very large than expected as per total Categories and Products you have, this will create your site to be slow. This generally gets too large if you edit the categories/products and change it‚Äôs URL. Generally we keep on changing the product URL to optimize for search engines or to correct some typo in the link. Magento saves all the previous category and product URLs even if it is changed many times, resulting in more number of URL rewrites in database. I have seen in one of the project, where total SKUs were near to 4,00,000 while the URL Rewrites were near to 46,00,000 with just one website and store!

Solution:
‚Äì First step is ofcourse, to take the backup of table core_url_rewrite
If something goes wrong then we can restore our old core_url_rewrite table to bring it back.

‚Äì Now truncate the table core_url_rewrite
truncate table core_url_rewrite in your Mysql console or from phpMyAdmin to empty this table.

‚Äì Re-index ‚ÄúCatalog URL Rewrite‚Äù from Index Management
This will create all the URL rewrites (current URLs only) for your categories and products and insert it into core_url_rewrite table.

item.title: Magento remove index.php from URL
item.description:
In Magento remove index.php from URL using below steps. It will convert your URL from

http://www.example.com/index.php/blah

to

http://www.example.com/blah

1.) In Magento Admin > System > Configuration > Web > Search Engine Optimization, change the value of Web Server Rewrites to Yes

Make sure your web server rewrite module is enabled. If you are using apache as your web server on Linux, you can check it by going to /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/rewrite.load, if rewrite.load is present there it means your rewrite module is enabled. If not, you will need to copy rewrite.load from /etc/apache2/mods-available/ and paste it at /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/ location. Then reload the apache by running service apache2 reload.

item.title: Magento clone collection – How to clone collection in Magento
item.description: Clone collection in Magento in an easy and effective way. Cloning collection in Magento is not as straight forward as we do in PHP object cloning. That‚Äôs because Magento does not implement clone in it‚Äôs collection object, which is why if you try to clone Magento collection it will nothing but just a copy of the original collection itself. If the original collection gets updated, this cloned will also get updated, which is what we don‚Äôt want right?
item.content:encoded:
Clone collection in Magento in an easy and effective way. Cloning collection in Magento is not as straight forward as we do in PHP object cloning. That‚Äôs because Magento does not implement clone in it‚Äôs collection object, which is why if you try to clone Magento collection it will nothing but just a copy of the original collection itself. If the original collection gets updated, this cloned will also get updated, which is what we don‚Äôt want right?

Let‚Äôs see an example where PHP‚Äôs clone keyword will fail. Consider you have an $collection in the class method and you want to perform operations on this $collection in two different ways. So you need to clone this $collection and perform operation differently in both the collections so that both collections have different result set.

{code type=php}$coll1 = clone $collection;
$coll2 = clone $collection;{/code}

Let‚Äôs perform different operations on these two separate collections now, like this:

{code type=php}$coll1->getSelect()->where(‚Äòfirst where condition‚Äô);
$coll2->getSelect()->where(‚Äòsecond where condition‚Äô);
if($coll1->getSize() == 0) {
$collection = $coll2;
} else {
$collection = $coll1;
}{/code}

But this will fail and not work what we expect here. $collection here will hold BOTH the where conditions, instead of any one depending on the result of IF condition.

To overcome this, in Magento, what you have to do is:

{code type=php}//Assuming you have original collection as $collection
$collection->getSelect()
->joinLeft(‚Äòtable1 as table1alias‚Äô, ‚Äòtable1alias.entity_id=e.entity_id‚Äô,array(‚Äòname‚Äô,‚Äôdescription‚Äô))
->where(‚Äò$firstWhereCondition‚Äô);

$coll = clone $collection;
if($coll->getSize() == 0) {
$fromPart = $collection->getSelect()->getPart(Zend_Db_Select::FROM); //getting all the FROM clause from collection
$wherePart = $collection->getSelect()->getPart(Zend_Db_Select::WHERE); //getting all the WHERE clause conditions from collection
//debug to see what you have to remove
//print_r($fromPart);print_r($wherePart);exit;

unset($fromPart[‚Äòtable1alias‚Äô]); //removing table1 join which we did for first where condition
unset($wherePart[0]); //removing first where condition, this may be different based on your query

//removed FROM and first WHERE condition from collection
$collection->getSelect()->setPart(Zend_Db_Select::FROM, $fromPart);
$collection->getSelect()->setPart(Zend_Db_Select::WHERE, $wherePart);

//now assign FROM and second WHERE condition to collection
$collection->getSelect()
->joinLeft(‚Äòtable1 as table1alias‚Äô, ‚Äòtable1alias.entity_id=e.entity_id‚Äô,array(‚Äòname‚Äô,‚Äôdescription‚Äô))
->where($secondWhereCondition);

//echo $collection->getSelect()->__toString();

}
echo $collection->getSize();{/code}

That‚Äôs it! You have just used one collection and applied two where conditions. Similarly you can even apply multiple FROM and WHERE clause conditions as per the requirement.

HTH!

item.title: Magento Recoverable Error Argument 1 passed to Mage_Core_Model_Store::setWebsite() must be an instance of Mage_Core_Model_Website
item.description:
Magento Recoverable Error: Argument 1 passed to Mage_Core_Model_Store::setWebsite() must be an instance of Mage_Core_Model_Website, null given, called in /var/www/xxx/app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/App.php on line 634 and defined in /var/www/xxx/app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/Store.php on line 395

When migrating Magento site from old server to new server, this error often occurs and appears in var/log/system.log. It prevents your Magento Admin to load JS and CSS files hence your admin panel becomes skinless.

The solution to get rid of this and load JS and CSS files is to run the following mysql commands in Mysql console or phpMyAdmin.
item.content:encoded:
Magento Recoverable Error: Argument 1 passed to Mage_Core_Model_Store::setWebsite() must be an instance of Mage_Core_Model_Website, null given, called in /var/www/xxx/app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/App.php on line 634 and defined in /var/www/xxx/app/code/core/Mage/Core/Model/Store.php on line 395

When migrating Magento site from old server to new server, this error often occurs and appears in var/log/system.log. It prevents your Magento Admin to load JS and CSS files hence your admin panel becomes skinless.

The solution to get rid of this and load JS and CSS files is to run the following mysql commands in Mysql console or phpMyAdmin.

{code type=sql}SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0;
UPDATE core\_store SET store_id = 0 WHERE code=‚Äôadmin‚Äô;
UPDATE core\_store\_group SET group_id = 0 WHERE name=‚ÄôDefault‚Äô;
UPDATE core\_website SET website_id = 0 WHERE code=‚Äôadmin‚Äô;
UPDATE customer\_group SET customer_group_id = 0 WHERE customer_group_code=‚ÄôNOT LOGGED IN‚Äô;
SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=1;{/code}

What the above mysql commands does is:
‚Äì Disables foreign key checks on tables so that you don‚Äôt get any foreign key errors while executing immediate update queries.
‚Äì Updates store, store_group and website tables with ID = 0, for admin user

Once the above set of queries are executed, don‚Äôt forget to clear cache to reflect your changes.

item.title: Magento Pinterest extension Auto Pin multiple product images Plugin
item.description: We all know that Pinterest is very popular and a great tool for marketing variety of products. It can give you huge traffic to your website resulting in incredible sales and revenue. It have almost all types of categories to hold your pinned images so that your product gets noticed to potential customers. It even has an option to specify the price of the product, which only gives you interested buyers to your website.
item.content:encoded:
We all know that Pinterest is very popular and a great tool for marketing variety of products. It can give you huge traffic to your website resulting in incredible sales and revenue. It have almost all types of categories to hold your pinned images so that your product gets noticed to potential customers. It even has an option to specify the price of the product, which only gives you interested buyers to your website.

If you have hundreds/thousands of products in your store and want to pin it on Pinterest it becomes very difficult, as Pinterest don‚Äôt provide multiple pinning of images. One by one pinning images is a nightmare if you have lots of products. There is also no official Pinterest API which can allow you to auto-pin your images through some kind of API.

If you are using Magento as your e-commerce framework, there‚Äôs a good news for you! There is an extension available at Magentools.com which gives you ability to auto-pin hundreds of product images in just one click! Other options includes to pin image with your Product Name, SKU and Price along with your product link on your website. This extension, called as Pinterest Auto Pin multiple images plugin acts as a bridge between your Magento store and Pinterest. In your Magento admin panel‚Äôs ‚ÄúManage Products‚Äù screen, you can see the option Pin To Board which loads all your Pinterest boards you want the product images to pin into! It also allows you to pin the individual product image pin when you create new product / edit existing product, by clicking on the tab ‚ÄúMagenTools‚Äù and selecting your desired Pinterest Board before saving the product.

It‚Äôs the must-have extension for the e-Commerce company which is more focused into marketing their products online and want more potential customers. You can find more details on the Pinterest Auto-Pin API extension here: http://magext.com/work/magento-social-network-auto-poster/

item.title: Magento add attribute to customer
item.description:
In Magento to add an attribute to customer is not an option in the admin panel like it does have for Product attribute. So you have to end up writing the script that will add your custom attribute in customer‚Äôs EAV tables.

Below code will insert your custom customer attribute in Magento system. You can even specify whil creating the attribute whether that attribute should appear in the forms (like register/signup) or not.
item.content:encoded:
In Magento to add an attribute to customer is not an option in the admin panel like it does have for Product attribute. So you have to end up writing the script that will add your custom attribute in customer‚Äôs EAV tables.

Below code will insert your custom customer attribute in Magento system. You can even specify whil creating the attribute whether that attribute should appear in the forms (like register/signup) or not.

{code type=php}$installer = $this;
$installer->startSetup();

$setup = new Mage_Eav_Model_Entity_Setup(‚Äòcore_setup‚Äô);

$entityTypeId = $setup->getEntityTypeId(‚Äòcustomer‚Äô);
$attributeSetId = $setup->getDefaultAttributeSetId($entityTypeId);
$attributeGroupId = $setup->getDefaultAttributeGroupId($entityTypeId, $attributeSetId);

$setup->addAttribute(‚Äòcustomer‚Äô, ‚Äòyour_attribute_code_here‚Äô, array(
‚Äòinput‚Äô => ‚Äòtext‚Äô, //or select or whatever you like
‚Äòtype‚Äô => ‚Äòint‚Äô, //or varchar or anything you want it
‚Äòlabel‚Äô => ‚ÄòAttribute description goes here‚Äô,
‚Äòvisible‚Äô => 1,
‚Äòrequired‚Äô => 0, //mandatory? then 1
‚Äòuser_defined‚Äô => 1,
));

$setup->addAttributeToGroup(
$entityTypeId,
$attributeSetId,
$attributeGroupId,
‚Äòyour_attribute_code_here‚Äô,
‚Äò100‚Äô
);

$oAttribute = Mage::getSingleton(‚Äòeav/config‚Äô)->getAttribute(‚Äòcustomer‚Äô, ‚Äòyour_attribute_code_here‚Äô);
$oAttribute->setData(‚Äòused_in_forms‚Äô, array(‚Äòadminhtml_customer‚Äô));
$oAttribute->save();

$setup->endSetup();{/code}

Here we have used our custom attribute‚Äôs:
‚Äì input type as text, but you can have it anything you like to appear in the form. It can be textarea, date, select or anything you want.
‚Äì data type as int, but you can have it anything from text, datetime, varchar or decimal. Remember customer is EAV in Magento, so it needs this information to store all the future values of this attribute in customer_entity_int (customer_entity_*) table.

item.title: Magento join EAV collection with Flat table
item.description:
Joining tables in Magento when it comes to EAV with Flat table is quite complicated. Consider you want to join sales_flat_order table with customer EAV tables to get Customer‚Äôs firstname and lastname, it becomes difficult as customer‚Äôs name comes from customer_entity_varchar table.

Below code will join sales order flat table with customer EAV to get customer‚Äôs full name in the collection along with all the order details.

{code type=php}$coll = Mage::getModel(‚Äòsales/order‚Äô)->getCollection();
item.content:encoded:
Joining tables in Magento when it comes to EAV with Flat table is quite complicated. Consider you want to join sales_flat_order table with customer EAV tables to get Customer‚Äôs firstname and lastname, it becomes difficult as customer‚Äôs name comes from customer_entity_varchar table.

Below code will join sales order flat table with customer EAV to get customer‚Äôs full name in the collection along with all the order details.

{code type=php}$coll = Mage::getModel(‚Äòsales/order‚Äô)->getCollection();

$fn = Mage::getModel(‚Äòeav/entity_attribute‚Äô)->loadByCode(‚Äò1‚Äô, ‚Äòfirstname‚Äô);
$ln = Mage::getModel(‚Äòeav/entity_attribute‚Äô)->loadByCode(‚Äò1‚Äô, ‚Äòlastname‚Äô);

$coll->getSelect()
->join(array(‚Äòce1‚Äô => ‚Äòcustomer_entity_varchar‚Äô), ‚Äòce1.entity_id=main_table.customer_id‚Äô, array(‚Äòfirstname‚Äô => ‚Äòvalue‚Äô))
->where(‚Äòce1.attribute_id=‚Äô.$fn->getAttributeId())
->join(array(‚Äòce2‚Äô => ‚Äòcustomer_entity_varchar‚Äô), ‚Äòce2.entity_id=main_table.customer_id‚Äô, array(‚Äòlastname‚Äô => ‚Äòvalue‚Äô))
->where(‚Äòce2.attribute_id=‚Äô.$ln->getAttributeId())
->columns(new Zend_Db_Expr(‚ÄúCONCAT(ce1.value, ‚Äò ‚Äò,ce2.value) AS fullname‚Äù));

print_r($coll->getData());{/code}

item.title: Magento: Check if any particular customer is currently logged in
item.description:

This little script will help you in finding all the currently active OR any particular customer(s) active in your store.

{code type=php}require ‚Äúapp/Mage.php‚Äù;
umask(0);
Mage::app();

$collection = Mage::getModel(‚Äòlog/visitor_online‚Äô)->prepare()->getCollection();

//Get all the customers that are logged in‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
foreach($collection->getData() as $cust) {
echo ‚ÄòCustomer ID: ‚Äò.$cust[‚Äòcustomer_id‚Äô] . ‚Äò
‚Äò;
echo ‚ÄòLast URL visited: ‚Äò.$cust[‚Äòlast_url‚Äô] . ‚Äò
‚Äò;

‚Äò;
echo ‚ÄòLast visit: ‚Äò.$cust[‚Äòlast_visit_at‚Äô] . ‚Äò
‚Äò;
echo ‚Äò======================
‚Äò;
}

item.title: pdo_mysql extension is not installed
item.description:
PHP Mysql Error: pdo_mysql extension is not installed.

Magento needs PDO Mysql extension for database connection and related things, so if you don‚Äôt have pdo_mysql extension enabled Magento will complain about this and will not proceed further installation. If you are not sure what PDO is, it‚Äôs high time for you to look at http://php.net/manual/en/ref.pdo-mysql.php

Coming back to error, to resolve this you will need to edit your php.ini file where it says:
;extension=pdo_mysql.so
item.content:encoded:
PHP Mysql Error: pdo_mysql extension is not installed.

Magento needs PDO Mysql extension for database connection and related things, so if you don‚Äôt have pdo_mysql extension enabled Magento will complain about this and will not proceed further installation. If you are not sure what PDO is, it‚Äôs high time for you to look at http://php.net/manual/en/ref.pdo-mysql.php

Coming back to error, to resolve this you will need to edit your php.ini file where it says:
;extension=pdo_mysql.so

Just uncomment the line by removing front semincolon, so it becomes
extension=pdo_mysql.so

Save it and restart the server, the error should go.

If you are on Windows, then that line should read:

extension=php_pdo_mysql.dll

If you don‚Äôt find pdo_mysql in php.ini, install php5-mysql by running the command:

sudo apt-get install php5-mysql (on Ubuntu)

sudo yum install php-mysql (on Redhat, Fedora, CentOS)

item.title: Change default length of Increment ID for orders, invoices, shipments, creditmemos
item.description:
By default in Magento CE 1.6, the default Increment ID of orders, invoices, shipments and creditmemos is 9 characters. If you want to make it short or long due to some other application dependency or whatever you will have to change the value of increment_pad_length in eav_entity_type table.

For changing it with some setup script installer, this code will do the trick:
{code type=php}$entityType = Mage::getModel(‚Äòeav/entity_type‚Äô)->loadByCode(‚Äòorder‚Äô); //invoice, shipment, creditmemo
$entityType->setIncrementPadLength(12)->save(); //changing length to 12{/code}
item.content:encoded:

For changing it with some setup script installer, this code will do the trick:

item.title: Magento: Can’t see product images in category page
item.description:
Set product image as small image and thumbnail programatically

If you see your images in product detail page but don‚Äôt see it in category page, it‚Äôs because your product have images (image attribute filled) but not small_image and thumbnail which are required to display on category page. If there are only few products you want to set small_image and thumbnail, then it‚Äôs easy to go to Manage Products > Individual Product > Images tab > Set small image and thumbnail radio button. But when it comes to hundreds/thousands of products, you better want it programatically way.
item.content:encoded:
Set product image as small image and thumbnail programatically

If you see your images in product detail page but don‚Äôt see it in category page, it‚Äôs because your product have images (image attribute filled) but not small_image and thumbnail which are required to display on category page. If there are only few products you want to set small_image and thumbnail, then it‚Äôs easy to go to Manage Products > Individual Product > Images tab > Set small image and thumbnail radio button. But when it comes to hundreds/thousands of products, you better want it programatically way.

Make a file in your Magento root and place the below code in it. Then run that file and you have just copied your Product Image to small image and thumbnail as well!

{code type=php}<?php ini_set(‘display_errors’,1); require ‘app/Mage.php’; Mage::app();

$products = Mage::getModel(‘catalog/product’)-?> getCollection()->addAttributeToSelect(‚Äò*‚Äô);
foreach ($products as $product) {
if (!$product->hasImage()) continue;
if (!$product->hasSmallImage()) $product->setSmallImage($product->getImage());
if (!$product->hasThumbnail()) $product->setThumbnail($product->getImage());
$product->save();
}
echo ‚ÄòFinished!‚Äô;
?>{/code}

item.title: Magento: Design Patterns
item.description:
Factory:

It implement the concept of factories and deals with the problem of creating objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created.
{code type=php}$product = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô);{/code}

Singleton:

It restricts the instantiation of a class to one object. It will refer to same object each time called.
{code type=php}$category = Mage::getSingleton(‚Äòcatalog/session‚Äô);{/code}

Registry:

It is a way to store information throughout your application.
{code type=php}Mage::register(‚Äòkey‚Äô,$value); //stores
$currentCategory = Mage::registry(‚Äòkey‚Äô); //retrives{/code}
item.content:encoded:
Factory:

It implement the concept of factories and deals with the problem of creating objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created.
{code type=php}$product = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô);{/code}

Singleton:

It restricts the instantiation of a class to one object. It will refer to same object each time called.
{code type=php}$category = Mage::getSingleton(‚Äòcatalog/session‚Äô);{/code}

Registry:

It is a way to store information throughout your application.
{code type=php}Mage::register(‚Äòkey‚Äô,$value); //stores
$currentCategory = Mage::registry(‚Äòkey‚Äô); //retrives{/code}

Prototype:

It determines the type of object to create. In Magento it can be Simple, Configurable, Grouped, Bundle, Downloadable or Virtual types.
{code type=php}Mage:getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)->getTypeInstance();{/code}

Observer:

It is mainly used to implement distributed event handling systems. Here the subject maintains a list of its dependents, called observers, and notifies them automatically of any state changes, usually by calling one of their methods.
{code type=php}Mage::dispatchEvent(‚Äòevent_name‚Äô, array(‚Äòkey‚Äô=>$value));{/code}

{code type=xml}


<event_name>

<unique_name>
Class_Name
methodName
</unique_name>

</event_name>


{/code}

Object Pool:

It is used to reuse and share objects that are expensive to create.
{code type=php}$id = Mage::objects()->save($object);
$object = Mage::objects($id);{/code}

Iterator:

It is used to traverse a collection and access the collection‚Äôs items.
{code type=php}Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)->getCollection();{/code}

Lazy Loading:

It is used to defer initialization of an object until the point at which it is needed.
{code type=php}$collection_of_products = Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô)
->getCollection();{/code}

Decorator:

It is used to extend or modify the behaviour of an object at runtime.
{code type=html}decorateTable(‘product_comparison’);{/code}

Helper:

Multiple methods are available for use by other objects. Here you can use core‚Äôs helper methods from anywhere in the application.
{code type=php}Mage::helper(‚Äòcore‚Äô);{/code}

Service Locator:

Allows overrides or renamed physical resources (e.g. Classes, DB tables, etc)
{code type=php}Mage::getModel(‚Äòcatalog/product‚Äô) and $installer->getTable(‚Äòcustomer/address_entity‚Äô);{/code}

Thanks to contributors at: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5041473/magento-design-patterns

item.title: Magento: Product Import error – shows HTML code while importing
item.description:
While importing products (somewhere around 1200 rows) by Magento‚Äôs in-built ‚ÄúSystem > Import/Export > Dataflow ‚Äì Profiles‚Äù I got an error where the Dashboard‚Äôs HTML was printed in the output.

The reason for this error is due to something wrong in CSV product data which Magento didn‚Äôt understand. Create a temporary CSV file with only few rows (2-4) and check if that works. If it works, that means there is some problem with rest of the data.

item.title: Magento: Reset download limit for downloadable product item/order
item.description: In Magento, downloadable products are the products which can be downloaded and does not require any shipping. When customer purchases this type of products, they get certain download limits to download their purchased items. This can be set in Products page in admin under ‚ÄúDownloadable Products‚Äù tab. In many cases store owner only want to give certain amount of downloads, so customers can‚Äôt download beyond that limit. But it may happen that due to bad internet or some interrupts downloads can‚Äôt be successful and customer want to reset that limit. For doing this, there is no option in backend to reset the download limits for the downloadable product items or for an entire order, and unfortunately admin use to re-order to achieve this.
item.content:encoded:
In Magento, downloadable products are the products which can be downloaded and does not require any shipping. When customer purchases this type of products, they get certain download limits to download their purchased items. This can be set in Products page in admin under ‚ÄúDownloadable Products‚Äù tab. In many cases store owner only want to give certain amount of downloads, so customers can‚Äôt download beyond that limit. But it may happen that due to bad internet or some interrupts downloads can‚Äôt be successful and customer want to reset that limit. For doing this, there is no option in backend to reset the download limits for the downloadable product items or for an entire order, and unfortunately admin use to re-order to achieve this.

Here is the query which will reset download limits for an entire order.
{code type=php}$q = Mage::getModel(‚Äòsales/order_item‚Äô)->getCollection()->addFieldToSelect(‚Äòorder_id‚Äô);
$q->getSelect()->joinRight(‚Äòdownloadable_link_purchased_item as d‚Äô, ‚Äòmain_table.item_id = d.order_item_id‚Äô,
array(‚Äòitem_id‚Äô,‚Äônumber_of_downloads_used‚Äô));
$q->getSelect()->where(‚Äòmain_table.order_id = ‚Äò. (int)$orderId);
$q->load();

//echo $q->getSelect()->__toString();exit;

$items = $q->getColumnValues(‚Äòitem_id‚Äô);
foreach($items as $id) {
Mage::getModel(‚Äòdownloadable/link_purchased_item‚Äô)->load($id)
->setStatus(‚Äòavailable‚Äô)->setNumberOfDownloadsUsed(0)->save();
}{/code}

The raw SQL query for the above Magento Convention query is:
UPDATE sales_flat_order_item s RIGHT JOIN downloadable_link_purchased_item d ON s.item_id = d.order_item_id SET d.number_of_downloads_used = 0 WHERE s.order_id = $orderId;

Here is another query that will allow you to reset download limits for a particular item in an order
{code type=php}$q = Mage::getModel(‚Äòsales/order_item‚Äô)->getCollection()->addFieldToSelect(‚Äòorder_id‚Äô);
$q->getSelect()->joinRight(‚Äòdownloadable_link_purchased_item as d‚Äô, ‚Äòmain_table.item_id = d.order_item_id‚Äô,
array(‚Äòitem_id‚Äô,‚Äônumber_of_downloads_used‚Äô));
$q->getSelect()->where(‚Äòmain_table.order_id = ‚Äò. (int)$orderId .‚Äô AND main_table.item_id = ‚Äò. (int)$orderItemId);
$q->load();

//echo $q->getSelect()->__toString();exit;

$items = $q->getColumnValues(‚Äòitem_id‚Äô);
foreach($items as $id) {
Mage::getModel(‚Äòdownloadable/link_purchased_item‚Äô)->load($id)
->setStatus(‚Äòavailable‚Äô)->setNumberOfDownloadsUsed(0)->save();
}{/code}

The raw SQL query for the above Magento Convention query is:
UPDATE sales_flat_order_item s RIGHT JOIN downloadable_link_purchased_item d ON s.item_id = d.order_item_id SET d.number_of_downloads_used = 0 WHERE s.order_id = $orderId AND s.item_id = $orderItemId;

HTH!

item.title: Magento 500 internal server error
item.description:
[Resolved]: Magento 500 internal server error
If you are getting ‚Äú500 Internal Server Error‚Äù then the reason might be permissions issue or fatal error.

In Magento, you can check the errors occured in files:
var/log/system.log
var/log/exception.log

You can even allow the error to output to your browser by editing your Magento index.php with:
error_reporting(E_ALL | E_STRICT);
ini_set(‚Äòdisplay_errors‚Äô, 1);

Also, try this to solve the error:
‚Äì Check the owner of your magento project. It should be the server (www-data for apache)
chown -R www-data:www-data .

You can even allow the error to output to your browser by editing your Magento index.php with:

Also, try this to solve the error:

‚Äì Change the directory permissions to 755 and file permissions to 644 for your project
find . -type d -exec chmod 0755 {} \;
find . -type f -exec chmod 0644 {} \;
chmod 550 pear
chmod 550 mage
chmod 755 -R var

‚Äì Check after upgrade do you have your .htaccess file inside Magento root

item.title: Linux/Magento: Daily useful development commands
item.description:
These are the daily commands I use at work. This will definately help someone who is not familiar with all these commands in Linux and Magento.

Linux: Search / Replace recursively

find /path/here/ -type f -exec sed -i ‚Äòs/search string/replace string/g‚Äô {} \;

Linux: Find all files matching a string

grep -r ‚Äústring to search‚Äù /path/to/search/

Linux: In vi editor, copy/paste/delete/replace/insert/save/undo/redo/search-replace/goto
Open file: vi filename
Copy: yy (yank) (for multiple lines copy, 5yy ‚Äì for copying 5 lines)
Paste: p
Delete: dd (for multiple lines delete, 5dd ‚Äì for deleting 5 lines)
Replace: r (on character you wish to replace, press r and enter new character)
Insert: i or insert key
Save: escape and : x (without space between : and x) (x = write and quit, w = write, q = quit, q! = quit without saving)
Undo: u
Redo: Ctrl+R
Search: escape key THEN / THEN write string to find THEN enter
Search-Replace: :%s/search string/replacement string/g
Goto Line number: escape key THEN : THEN line number (e.g. :22 to go to 22nd line of current file)

Linux: Search previous execute command in terminal

in terminal, press Ctrl+R and type few characters.
This will show you previous command matching that sequence of characters
To check another command matching same characters, press Ctrl+R again

owner / read (4) + write (2) + execute (1)

You can‚Äôt guarantee that your database will be secure especially if you are on a cloud storage. Backups are MUST and if it‚Äôs automated, life becomes very easier.
